cleaned.title: [TEMP CHECK] Onboard & Enable LBTC/WBTC liquid E-Mode on Aave v3 Core Instance

raw.title: [TEMP CHECK] Onboard & Enable LBTC/WBTC liquid E-Mode on Aave v3 Core Instance
raw.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193
raw.body:
## Author: @ACI
## Date: 2024-11-28

---


# **Summary**

This proposal aims to onboard and enable LBTC/WBTC (Lombard) liquid E-Mode for the Main Instance. By implementing this change, we seek to enhance capital efficiency for borrowers using LBTC/WBTC as collateral.

# **Motivation**

The motivation behind this proposal stems from several key factors:

- High Utilization: LBTC/WBTC has demonstrated significant usage as collateral for borrowing stablecoins on other platforms.
- Capital Efficiency: Enabling liquid E-Mode for LBTC/WBTC will allow borrowers to substantially improve their capital efficiency when using this asset as collateral.
- Controlled Growth: Liquid E-Mode provides a mechanism for more precise control over the growth and borrow demand in relation to the overall stablecoin liquidity within Aave v3 on Core Instance.

By implementing this proposal, we aim to optimize the use of LBTC/WBTC within the Aave ecosystem, attracting more liquidity for the protocol and increasing revenues.

# **Specification**

This proposal will add LBTC/WBTC liquid E-Mode. Risk Parameters will be provided by Risk Service Providers and ARFC will be updated accordingly when ARFC is posted if it passes this TEMP CHECK.

## Useful links

[**BGD. Aave v3.2: Liquid Emodes**](https://governance.aave.com/t/bgd-aave-v3-2-liquid-emodes/19037) 

[**ARFC Snapshot**](https://snapshot.org/#/aave.eth/proposal/0x68ce69b5e71df1d77c2ad814a5d41162a40be54473576ff590d0b1bb5afde4a7)

[**Github**](https://github.com/aave-dao/aave-v3-origin/tree/v3.2.0)

[**AIP**](https://vote.onaave.com/proposal/?proposalId=178)

# Disclaimer

This proposal is directly powered by ACI (Aave Chan Initiative). ACI did not received compensation for creation of this proposal.

# Next Steps

1. If consensus is reached on this TEMP CHECK, escalate this proposal to the Snapshot stage.
2. If Snapshot passes, escalate to ARFC and then Snapshot.
3. If the ARFC snapshot outcome is YAE, publish an AIP vote for final confirmation and enforcement of the proposal

# Copyright

Copyright and related rights waived via [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/).

raw.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193
raw.body:
## Author: ACI (Aave Chan Initiative)

## Date: 2024-11-06

---
> Risk Parameters have been updated accordingly with Risk Service Providers feedback 2024-11-20


# **Summary**

This proposal aims to enable cbBTC/WBTC liquid E-Mode for the Main Instance. By implementing this change, we seek to enhance capital efficiency for borrowers using cbBTC/WBTC as collateral, particularly for borrowing other stablecoins.

# **Motivation**

The motivation behind this proposal stems from several key factors:

- High Utilization: cbBTC/WBTC has demonstrated significant usage as collateral for borrowing stablecoins on the platform.
- Capital Efficiency: Enabling liquid E-Mode for cbBTC/WBTC will allow borrowers to substantially improve their capital efficiency when using this asset as collateral.
- Controlled Growth: Liquid E-Mode provides a mechanism for more precise control over the growth and borrow demand in relation to the overall stablecoin liquidity within Aave v3 on Mainnet.
- Enhanced Borrowing Capacity: This change will enable users to borrow larger amounts of other stablecoins against their cbBTC/WBTC collateral, potentially increasing platform utilization and revenue.

By implementing this proposal, we aim to optimize the use of cbBTC/WBTC within the Aave ecosystem, attracting more liquidity for stablecoins.

# **Specification**

This proposal will add cbBTC/WBTC liquid E-Mode

> Risk Parameters have been updated accordingly with Risk Service Providers feedback 2024-11-20

### cbBTC/WBTC  E-Mode

| Parameter | Value | Value |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Asset | cbBTC | WBTC |
| Collateral | Yes | No |
| Borrowable | No | Yes |
| Max LTV | 93% | - |
| Liquidation Threshold | 95% | - |
| Liquidation Penalty | 1% | - |

## Useful links

[**BGD. Aave v3.2: Liquid Emodes**](https://governance.aave.com/t/bgd-aave-v3-2-liquid-emodes/19037) 

[**ARFC Snapshot**](https://snapshot.org/#/aave.eth/proposal/0x68ce69b5e71df1d77c2ad814a5d41162a40be54473576ff590d0b1bb5afde4a7)

[**Github**](https://github.com/aave-dao/aave-v3-origin/tree/v3.2.0)

[**AIP**](https://vote.onaave.com/proposal/?proposalId=178)

# Disclaimer

This proposal is directly powered by ACI (Aave Chan Initiative). ACI did not received compensation for creation of this proposal.

# Next Steps

1. If consensus is reached on this ARFC, escalate this proposal to the Snapshot stage.
2. If the ARFC snapshot outcome is YAE, publish an AIP vote for final confirmation and enforcement of the proposal

# Copyright

Copyright and related rights waived via [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/).

cleaned.title: [ARFC] Onboard sUSDe to Aave V3 on Ethereum
cleaned.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193

raw.title: [ARFC] Onboard sUSDe to Aave V3 on Ethereum
raw.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193
raw.body:
---
### [ARFC]  Onboard sUSDe to Aave V3 on Ethereum 

### Author:  ACI (Aave Chan Initiative)

### Date: 2024-04-01

---

### **Summary**

This is an ARFC to seek approval for the addition of sUSDe to Aave V3 on Ethereum, following the consensus reached in the [TEMP CHECK](https://snapshot.org/#/aave.eth/proposal/0x3263dbee34f5afe513a1a6c5bcd5207684cee03473e1b3d7616993dbd87ab881) stage.

### **Motivation**

As discussed in the TEMP CHECK, Ethena's synthetic dollar, USDe, provides a stable crypto-native solution for a cash and carry structured product. The staked version of USDe, sUSDe, earns yield from the protocol and has high potential for strong borrow demand. 

### **Specification**

sUSDe: [0x9d39a5de30e57443bff2a8307a4256c8797a3497](https://etherscan.io/token/0x9d39a5de30e57443bff2a8307a4256c8797a3497)

### Risk Parameters

Risk parameters have been provided by Chaos Labs in the ARFC discussion thread. 

Initial Risk Parameters are the following:

| Parameter | Value |
| --- | --- |
| Isolation Mode | Yes |
| Borrowable | No |
| Collateral Enabled | Yes |
| Supply Cap (sUSDe) | 85M |
| Debt Ceiling |40M |
| LTV | 72.00% |
| LT | 75.00% |
| Liquidation Bonus | 8.50% |
| Liquidation Protocol Fee | 10.00%|
|Flashloanable|No|
|Siloed Borrowing|No|
|Borrowed in Isolation|No|
|Emode|No|

### **Useful Links**

[TEMP CHECK](https://governance.aave.com/t/temp-check-onboard-susde-to-aave-v3-on-ethereum/16840)
[TEMP CHECK Snapshot](https://snapshot.org/#/aave.eth/proposal/0x3263dbee34f5afe513a1a6c5bcd5207684cee03473e1b3d7616993dbd87ab881)

### Disclaimer

This proposal is powered by Skywards. The Aave Chan Initiative is not directly affiliated with Ethena and did not receive compensation for creation this proposal.

### **Next Steps**

1. Collect community & service providers feedback on this ARFC.
2. Escalate the proposal to ARFC snapshot stage if feedback is positive.
3. If the ARFC snapshot outcome is YAE, publish an AIP vote for final confirmation and enforcement of the proposal.

### Copyright

Copyright and related rights waived under [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/)

raw.title: [ARFC] Onboard FRAX to Aave v3 Lido Instance
raw.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193
raw.body:
## **Author: ACI**

## **Date: 2024-10-04**

---
> ARFC has been updated with Risk Parameters provided by Risk Service Providers 2024-10-08

---

### **Summary**

This proposal aims to onboard FRAX to the Aave v3 Lido Instance.

### **Motivation**

The integration of FRAX into the Aave v3 Lido Instance is driven by the following factors:

1. FRAX Adoption: Frax is also taking a new place in Aave ecosystem with harmonization between FRAX and USDC parameters.
2. Liquidity Enhancement: The inclusion of this widely-used stablecoin is expected to boost liquidity in the Lido Instance, potentially attracting more users and increasing overall platform activity.
3. Strategic Alignment: This move aligns with Aaveâ€™s goal of offering a comprehensive suite of high-quality assets, keeping the protocol at the forefront of DeFi liquidity.

### **Proof of Liquidity and Deposit Commitments**

FRAX has pledged liquidity provision support. These will complement the ongoing incentives for the Lido Instance.

### **Specification**

Contract addresses:

FRAX: 0x853d955aCEf822Db058eb8505911ED77F175b99e

> ARFC has been updated with Risk Parameters provided by Risk Service Providers 2024-10-08

| **Parameter** | FRAX |
| --- | --- |
| Chain-Instance | Ethereum-Lido |
| Isolation Mode | No |
| Borrowable | Yes |
| Collateral Enabled | No |
| Supply Cap | 20,000,000 |
| Borrow Cap | 18,000,000 |
| Debt Ceiling | - |
| LTV | - |
| LT | - |
| Liquidation Bonus | - |
| Liquidation Protocol Fee | - |
| Variable Base | 0% |
| Variable Slope1 | 5.5% |
| Variable Slope2 | 75% |
| Uoptimal | 90% |
| Reserve Factor | 20% |
| Stable Borrowing | Disabled |
| Flashloanable | Yes |
| Siloed Borrowing | Disabled |
| Borrowable in Isolation | No |
| E-Mode Category | - |

### **Disclaimer:**

This proposal is powered by Skywards. ACI is not directly affiliated with FRAX and did not receive compensation for creation of this proposal.

**Next Steps**

1. If consensus is reached on this [ARFC], escalate this proposal to the Snapshot stage.
2. If the ARFC snapshot outcome is YAE, publish an AIP vote for final confirmation and enforcement of the proposal.

### **Copyright:**

Copyright and related rights waived under [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/)

decision.summary: The proposal to onboard and enable eBTC/WBTC liquid E-Mode on Aave v3 Core Instance is strongly supported by voting timeline analysis and historical precedent. It aims to enhance capital efficiency and borrowing capacity, with stable and unanimous vote momentum for approval. Forum sentiment is mixed but mostly neutral, not opposing the change. Similar past proposals introducing new collateral or strategic shifts passed and led to positive platform outcomes.
key_arguments_for: Enables higher capital efficiency for borrowers using eBTC/WBTC collateral.
Controlled growth mechanism via liquid E-Mode aligns borrow demand with stablecoin liquidity.
Historical similar proposals passed and led to increased platform utilization and positive market response.
Voting timeline shows consistent and stable support throughout the voting period.
key_arguments_against: Forum discussion includes some concerns about risks associated with increased borrowing capacity.
Slight TVL decline observed post-vote, though price impact was positive.

evidence.quote: First comment expresses concerns about risks despite the proposal's capital efficiency benefits.
Timeline analysis shows unanimous and stable early support with no vote volatility, recommending 'YAE'.
Similar past proposals on onboarding new collateral/features passed with strong 'YAE' votes and positive market impact.

decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'YAE' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
- Voting timeline metrics show unanimous and stable support for 'YAE', indicating strong consensus.
- Forum sentiment is mostly neutral with some negative feedback, but does not contradict the voting outcome, supporting alignment with community views.
- Historical lessons from similar proposals show successful onboarding of new collateral/features leading to increased platform utilization, reinforcing the positive expected impact.
- Market data shows positive token price impact, suggesting investor confidence, while TVL dip is minor and does not outweigh benefits.
Thus, the recommendation to select 'YAE' aligns with the organization's long-term benefit and reflects the aggregated sentiment and vote dynamics.
